moves.1. f4:
Hi everyone!

I have forgotten to annotate a couple of games in the Annotations Project Part 2. Both of these were against Class C Opposition.  I will remedy that right now.  The first one is against Graham (Goatfodder) who is a bit like The Dentist, i.e. ok up to late/middlegame and will then make a mistake that will let me into the game big time and then go on to win it.  I will start the commentary on Move 9 as the previous moves are fairly standard to this particular opening.
moves.1... d5 2. Nf3 g6 3. e4 dxe4 4. Ng5 Nf6: 9. ...... Bg7 - this move has turned out to be black's best reply due to the fact that Fou Lenoir bears down on the a1-h8 diagonal, making it awkward for a queenside fianchetto of the white dsb later on.
moves.10. Ne6: 10. Ne6 - a standard cramp.  Glenda goes to g8.  My rook is hemmed in but I may somehow be able to rectify this later on.
moves.10... Qg8 11. Nc3 Bxc3 12. bxc3: 12. bxc3 - Fou Lenoir is traded for one of the knights.  Hmm, I think I have made things easy for Graham as he now has the bishop pair!  Thankfully Graham is not the Master Mater!
moves.12... h5 13. Bh3 b6: 13. ...... b6 - I now try and find a bolt-hole for Henry.
moves.14. Bb2 Qf7: 14. ..... Qf7 - Glenda moves to f7 give my rook on h8 some leg room!
moves.15. Rf1 Na6: 15. ..... Na6 - bit worried about the WR and Glenda being on the same file.  I do a Risk Assessment and decide that she is OK there for now and decided to clear the decks on my back row.
moves.16. Nd4+ Kb7 17. Be6 Qe8 18. c4 Rd8: 18. ...... Rd8 - moves the rook out of a possible skewer on the h1-a8 diagonal.  It also paves the way for queenside castling by hand.
moves.19. Nb5 Rh7: 19. ...... Rh7 - evasive action from white's dsb on b2.
moves.20. Rd1 c6: 20. ...... c6 - kicks the knight away from b5.
moves.23. d3 exd3 24. cxd3: 24. cxd3 - pawn trade.  White is covered at the moment but he must be a little careful.  All it may need is for Glenda or a rook to go to the e column and the WK will be caught in an Epaulet Mate!
moves.24... Nb4 25. g3 Rxd4: 25. ..... Rxd4 - I now formulate a two step plan to exchange my rook for B and N.  This will break up the bishop pair and give me bags of room!
moves.26. Bxd4 Nc2+: 26. ..... Nc2+ - stage 2 of the plan, a knight fork.  The bishop on d4 will drop next move.  Neat.
moves.27. Kf2 Nxd4 28. Rdb1 Kc7 29. Rfe1 c5: 29. .... c5 - I decided to support my knight which has a fine outpost on d4.
moves.30. a4 a5: 30.  ...... a5 - this prophylactic move is to ensure that the white rooks bite on granite!
moves.31. Re5 Qe8 32. Rbe1 Qxa4: 32. ..... Qxa4 - the white rooks double up on my e7 pawn but hallo, allo, allo.  Glenda is on the rampage.
moves.33. Rd5 Qc2+ 34. Kf1 Qxd3+: 34. ..... Qxd3+ - another p(r)awn for Henry's dining table tonight!
moves.35. Kf2 Qf3+ 36. Kg1 Ne2+: 36. ..... Ne2+ - trying to catch the WK in a mating net.  Graham must now give up his rook for my knight and I am already +6 in material!
moves.37. Rxe2 Qxe2 38. Rd7+ Kc6 39. Ra7 Qxc4: 39. ..... Qxc4 - Yet another p(r)awn - Henry will certainly not go hungry tonight!
moves.40. Bg2+ Kd6: 40. ..... Kd6 - but he must take some evasive action first.
moves.41. h4 Qd4+ 42. Kh2 Qf2: 42. ..... Qf2 - Glenda now tries to entomb the WK but allows him the squares of h1 and h3.  Must look out that I do not deliver the wrong kind of mate should the rooks disappear off the board.
moves.45. Rd8+ Kc7 46. Rd3 Qb2 47. Be4 c2: 47. .... c2 - is this gonna be Glenda 2?
moves.49. Bxh5: 49. Bxh5 - aha not Bxh7, I think we may have a stalemate try here.
moves.49... Rxh5 50. g4 Qh1+: 50. ...... Qh1+ - but Glenda 2 ensures I will not be denied!
moves.51. Kg3 Qbg2#: 51. ..... Qbg2# - it was Xmas Eve when gameknot announced that I delivered mate - the last move was set as a conditional - so a nice bit of festive cheer for me!  Hope you have had a good read.  Bye for now - Joanne

gameName: The Annotation Project II - A Patient Win
